name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
I love living near the ocean here in Pacific Grove and walk daily with my dogs on the beach.I am a hair stylist and own a salon in Carmel, I own and renovate old houses and love to travel to tropical places. I enjoy walking to great restaurants and the  Farmer's market all within two blocks. This is the perfect location!
I hope your wanderings lead you to places you love.

name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.94 · 6 bedrooms · 8 beds · 4 baths
neighborhood_overview:
I call Pacific Grove "Iowa with a Beach". It is a really friendly small town with everything you need within 1 mile of the house. We have a lovely Farmers Market, Natural History Museum, Movie Theater, shops, restaurants, wildlife and butterflies!
In May 2015, Trip Advisor chose Pacific Grove as one of the top 12 Scenic Destinations in all of the United States. You will love it here!
host_about: I love sharing my home with families on vacation, enjoying a reunion or celebrating a special event. 2022 begins my 12th year hosting guests, and I am very grateful to all of you who come back year after year!

name: Guesthouse in Pacific Grove · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Hands down, the best part about our 'hood is the proximity to the ocean.  You can (usually) hear it, and smell it from our house, and see its amazing beauty within a brief walk.  On a clear night, the sunsets are breathtaking.
host_about: My passion for birdwatching has taken me all over the world.  While I adore international adventures, I also regularly road trip throughout the beautiful west.  I have a 9 year old plus an king-sized 5 year old and enjoy exploring the world through their eyes. We love and show our Irish Wolfhounds.

name: Guest suite in Pacific Grove · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This is a safe and quiet neighborhood.  Many of my neighbors have lived here for decades and they're friendly, kind people. There are lots of kids here, so PLEASE drive  no more than 15MPH once you're in the cul-de-sac. Thanks!!
host_about:
Hi Fellow Airbnbers,
I lived in Pacific Grove for seventeen years and after a two year adventure in Nova Scotia, I am back home!  Before Pacific Grove, I was a longtime Bay Area resident (SF and Berkeley) and am a native Californian.  I have had a variety of careers over the years, but my hobby has always been songwriting. You may occasionally hear (muffled) piano playing and singing from the main house. Being an Airbnb host is a perfect fit for me because I genuinely want guests to have a magical stay while they're here. I am an old school  host (over 1300 reviews ) who believes Airbnb is still about people and community.  I do my best to create a space that will help you relax and renew your spirit.

name: Condo in Pacific Grove · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in a centrally located and within walking distance to beach town aquarium and Cannery Row.
host_about:
I love to travel. Every summer I visit my family in Germany and Italy. I am a Graphic Designer, so I work wherever I go. I love design which reflects my home, which is clean simple, lots of light and photography. I love photography as well and my daughter followed into my footsteps and got a degree at Brooks Institute, so be prepared to see beautiful art. 
My life's motto: you cant figure out life you have to live it! ;)

Enjoy!

name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.82 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths

host_about: World Champion Chef for 2022. Rice and Noodle World Champion. Will compete this May for $100,000 with the other 9 world champions. Interior Designer and host of Bringing it to the Table, farm to table docuseries that we hope to have on Netflix this year.

name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about: We enjoy Pacific Grove and all the activities that the area has to offer like the Monterey Bay Aquarium, the ocean and beach, Carmel, Big Sur, Santa Cruz, and all the fabulous dinning opportunities. Being a family, variety is important and Monterey Bay provides something for everybody!!

name: Home in Monterey · ★4.59 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Can walk to the famous Cannery Row, coffee shops , restaurants, grocery stores in five minutes.
Distance from the property to :
Knob Hill 0.3 miles (5 minutes walk)
Cannary Row (Aquarium) 0.5 miles ( 7 minutes walk)
Safe Way 1.1 miles
Trader Joes 1.0 miles
Downtown Monterey ( Alvarado St.) 1.9 miles
Pebble Beach (Spanish Bay) 2.0 miles
Carmel 6 miles
host_about:
Over the years, I have been fortunate to have rubbed elbows with some of the most talented people in the Hospitality and Real Estate professions.  Little did I know these mentors would prepare me for my Vacation Rental venture this year.

I've also discovered my inner gift for interior decorating.  Casa Amarilla has been a labor-of-love restoring and modernizing this quaint Monterey Cottage...a stone throw from the Aquarium.

My green thumb came back to life as well.  The patio and fenced garden area has blossomed this spring, and soothes one's sole at the end of an active day.  A wood burning pot belly fire-pit and charcoal BBQ enhance this spacious artistic zen-like garden, while taking in the distant Monterey Bay view...our guests favorite!

While staying at Casa Amarilla, don't hesitate to call or text me if you and your group need anything at all!

Sincerely,
Guita

name: Place to stay in Pacific Grove · ★4.66 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: What I love about the neighborhood is that it is safe, scenic, a couple blocks to the beach, a short walk to Pebble Beach's Spanish Bay and Seventeen Mile Drive and right around the corner from Asilomar Conference Grounds, a five minute drive to downtown Pacific Grove and Lover's Point, a ten minute drive to Monterey and the Monterey Bay Aquarium, Cannery Row, and the Fisherman's Wharf, a fifteen minute drive to Downtown Carmel and only a forty five minute drive down scenic Hwy 1 to beautiful Big Sur.  Activities in the area include great restaurants and dining, world renown golfing, hiking, biking, walking the scenic coastline, wine tasting, whale watching, kayaking, surfing, scuba diving, art galleries, and the list goes on.
host_about: I have lived on the Monterey Peninsula for thirty four years and have practiced as a Massage Therapist for twenty five years.  I enjoy living in places that offer an abundance of natural beauty and I walk the coastline almost every day with my dogs never taking for granted how blessed I am to be here.  I have traveled to Korea, Japan, Hong Kong, Australia, New Zealand, Canada, Mexico and many places in the United States and have always found it interesting to learn about different cultures and people.  I enjoy cooking as well as a good meal out, receiving massages as well as giving them, time with family and friends, reading a good book, watching a good movie and meeting new and interesting people.  My life motto is to enjoy the journey!

name: Home in Pacific Grove · 3 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.92 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the small-town charm of Pacific Grove as you explore the many shops and restaurants of this Central Coast town. With the world famous 17 miles drive and Pebble Beach as your back drop, you can experience why some have called this region as the  paradise on earth. There are endless things to do such as biking or hiking through the beautiful trails along the beach; kayaking, snorkeling, or scuba diving in the Monterey Bay. Don't forget to discover the dramatic exhibits at the Monterey Bay Aquarium or historic Cannery Row. Another great area attraction for fine dining and souvenirs is the Monterey Fisherman’s Wharf where some of the country’s best seafood and clam chowder are served.
host_about:
I am an engineer working in the Silicon Valley.  My wife and I have been married for over 30 years.  We enjoy biking, hiking, skiing, and traveling all over.  We love the Monterey and Pacific Grove area ever since we took our two kids on a bike trailer going through 17 miles drive when they were just babies.  We bought this house in Pacific Grove and we like to share this beautiful area with other folks from all over the world. 

Our motto in life is:  work hard and play even harder.

neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove is a beautiful small beach town with a relaxed atmosphere. There is plenty of beach access and scenic hiking or biking trails from the property. The house backs onto a little alley road that runs along a gorgeous, wooded park.

name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Pacific Grove offers an unparalleled quality of life. Sharing borders with the Monterey Bay, City of Monterey, Pacific Ocean, and the Del Monte Forest, our town offers breathtaking views and recreational activities. The City provides services to the community including: excellent fire, emergency, and ocean rescue services; an award-winning natural history museum; the lowest crime rate of any city in Monterey County; a nationally-recognized 18-hole golf course; a monarch butterfly habitat sanctuary; sandy beaches; and, the oldest continuously-operating lighthouse on the west coast. We are known for our small-town hospitality and friendliness in a place we simply call 'P.G.' (from The City of Pacific Grove website)
host_about: Meet the family! ... Gary (Dad), Jim (Stacey's Husband), Stacey (Daughter), Lynea (Mom), Amy (Daughter), and Michael (Amy's husband). We have always had a deep love of family togetherness and making memories. We built our family cabin in Arnold in 1983, and bought a darling carriage house in Pacific Grove  together in 2014.  We poured all our love and care into renovating it—to create a special retreat not only for our family, but for yours. We believe that memories shared are some of the most precious times in life. Please come for a visit and share some of yours with us!

name: Home in Monterey · ★4.72 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is one of the historic neighborhoods of Monterey, known as New Monterey, up on the hill above Lighthouse Avenue. It's a nice neighborhood with views of the Bay, fresh air, trees and birds, great neighbors.

It's easy walking distance to Safeway, Trader Joe's and many cafes and restaurants, also very close to DLI and Cannery Row.
Five minutes drive to Community Hospital (CHOMP).
Ten minute drive to Carmel or Downtown Monterey.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Monterey. I've driven a taxi here off and on for many years, and have really enjoyed getting to know the community from this perspective. Monterey Peninsula is a very interesting and diverse place with a lot of great people.

I like to read, go to movies, and walk on the beach with Wendy. I like meeting the people who visit Monterey, and I like to travel too. I like reading about current events, science and history. Wendy likes social media, shopping and thrift stores.

neighborhood_overview: Our home is centrally located in the Monterey Bay. Beautiful hiking trails in the city of Pebble Beach located within a few minutes walking distance from our house.
host_about: Hello, my name is Toni and my daughters name is Sophia. We have lived  on the Monterey Peninsula for twenty two years now. We are great lovers of nature and what it has to offer.  Both of us are ocean girls born and raised on the ocean. We are honored to host you. Thank you!

name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.85 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: We live on a lovely cul-de-sac street in Pacific Grove which is quiet and cozy.  Please drive slowly on the cul de sac!One block away is the the bus stop.  Two blocks away is Forest Ave. (highway 68) which, if you turn left will take you straight to Ocean Ave. and the beaches. Turn right and you can walk or drive the trail to Cannery Row, Fisherman's Warf and Monterey.  Turn right and it will take you to Asilomar, Pebble Beach, Carmel and eventually Big Sur.  Please park in our driveway.  Please drive slowly in the cul de sac!!!
host_about: My husband and I are retired educators.  We are quiet people renting a Master Bedroom and Bathroom in the second floor of our home.  Pacific Grove is beautiful and there are great restaurants in town or in Cannery Row.  We are close to the Monterey Bay, and the Aquarium voted the best in the country.  Additionally next to the Aquarium is historic Steinbeck's Cannery Row with a variety of great restaurants.  Pacific Grove offers fine restaurants and a quaint downtown, all within walking distance.  Our kitchen is not available at this time because of renovations.  However we live less than a mile from Pebble Beach with Spanish Bay's restaurants, AT&T's Golf Tournament and only 30 miles from Big Sur, one of the most scenic drives is the world. name: Guest suite in Pacific Grove · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is located in a pine and oak forest.  Between us and the shoreline (about a block away) is a row of sand dunes that shelters our garden from the winds off the ocean.  The neighborhood is very quiet and peaceful, with very little traffic..  Asilomar State Park and Conference Grounds (and Asilomar beach) is just around the corner, and the historic Point Pinos Lighthouse (built in 1855) is also an easy 15 minute walk away. The Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary, which give Pacific Grove its title of "Butterfly Town USA" is right in our neighborhood and just a ten minute stroll from our place.

name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The house is a half mile walk from the Monterey Bay Aquarium and Cannery Row shops and restaurants. Less than half a mile in the other direction is downtown Pacific Grove with more shops and restaurants.  A binder in the kitchen shows some of your options. Thousands of Monarch Butterflies overwinter (October to March)  in Pacific Grove. You can visit the Butterfly  Sanctuary where they cluster in the trees to conserve heat when the temperature is lower than 55 degrees F.  When they sunlight warms them, they fly off to gather nectar.  You can often see them hanging in the trees or flying about.  Monterey Bay is visible from the house and less than half a mile away.  Beaches (Lovers Point for family beach  play is great), bike and walking/running trails await.  Drive a short way down Highway 1 to Point Lobos for hiking and viewing ocean cliffs or to Carmel Valley for wine tasting.  Take a whale watching cruise in Moss Landing ( Sanctuary Cruises) or try clam chowder sample tasting from M
host_about: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in the Monterey Bay Area in 1969 and fell in love with it.  In 2015 we found this lovely house.  We hope you enjoy the area and our home as much as we do!

name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Centrally located to experience Pebble Beach, Monterey and Carmel. A drive around the bay takes you to Santa Cruz and a short drive south leads to Big Sur. The studio has a "peak" of the ocean and you can definitely hear the ocean on most nights. Asilomar is less than a mile away as is the recreation trail to walk, job or ride your bike. host_about:

Cheers! To safe getaways and discovery.

name: Guest suite in Pacific Grove · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We live in a very safe and peaceful neighborhood.  Pacific Grove has an extremely low crime rate. One of the safest places in America! Very family-friendly. name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a short few blocks to the open ocean, "rural" side of Pacific Grove. The 17 Mile Drive entrance to Pebble Beach is a two blocks down the road. Asilomar State Park and Beach is a short walk away. Downtown Pacific Grove, Lover's Point Beach and the recreation trail leading to the Monterey Bay aquarium and Cannery Row is a mile away (easy walk or bike ride). There is a Monterey Bay Transit bus stop a block away. Forested George Washington park is directly behind the cottage. You will hear happy kids playing ball sometimes during the day and there are short trails through the park (no night lights). My neighbors are kind and friendly. The Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary is nearby. Sometimes in the fall, monarchs will make their way through the backyard and park depending on the time of the year. Deer, raccoons and sometimes possum will be sighted. Nature is the main theme!
host_about:
Hi there! am a native "Pagrovian" and teach in town. I feel so fortunate to have been raised in P.G., and then raise my three daughters here as well! I love sharing my cottage with Airbnb guests and have done so for the past few years. Big Sur is one of my favorite places in the world to spend time. I love sharing ideas of local places to visit and am happy to answer any questions! I truly believe that sand is NOT dirt! 
I am excited to share my childhood home with guests on the bay side of town! Thank you for checking out the Sea Otter Sanctuary Cottage! Happy planning and travels to you!

name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:

In Pacific Grove's Forest Hill shopping district (distinct from downtown and a one-mile drive from the house), you'll find supermarkets, larger stores
host_about: I'm Chris. I host a single home with undivided attention and never use property managers or co-hosts. I've lived in Pacific Grove for more than 20 years and I'm happy to answer questions about the house, town, and area. During your stay, you can reach me by email, text message, phone, or in person. Should we pass each other during the course of your stay, feel free to ask a question, chat, or just wave hello. I'm fully vaccinated for Covid-19.

name: Home in Pacific Grove · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: PG is an often-overlooked coastal gem. Its tree-lined streets and Victorian architecture still evoke faint echos of its 19th century days as a Methodist retreat. Our neighborhood is also the shoreline of the Monterey Bay National Marine Sanctuary, and our home is just across from the Pacific Grove Golf Links, adding wonderful open space. It's a short, easy walk to both downtown "PG" with its quaint B&Bs, coffeehouses and restaurants, as well as the Coastal Recreation Trail and the beach at Lovers Point where you can rent kayaks, bicycles and surreys.  Our street is wide and the driveway is large enough for large vehicles and even an RV. We're also convenient to major and local events, being a short drive or bike ride from the Concours d'Elegance,  AT&T tournament, Jazz Festival and other Peninsula special events. Pacific Grove has its own hometown events well worth taking in, from Good Old Days in April to the Butterfly Parade in October. The monarch butterfly sanctuary is a short walk
host_about:
Hank and I have raised three daughters (now all in their 20's) in this home.  In 2016 we decided to undergo a major remodel to turn our house from child-centric to a comfortable open living space to enjoy and entertain.  We're loving it and hope you do too!
We're active 60-somethings who love the sport of triathlon and its individual components of running, biking and swimming. The Monterey Peninsula is a great place for active people.
We love traveling (you'll see the world map with our family's various travel spots), both domestically and abroad.  Our newest purchase is an RV to explore the U.S.

name: Cottage in Pacific Grove · ★4.99 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: This historic "retreat" neighborhood of Pacific Grove is highly coveted and sought after by second home owners & vacationers from around the world. Attracted by the many charming Victorian houses that comprise this neighborhood & the close proximity to the beautiful beach & town, this neighborhood is a walkers paradise so park the car & enjoy all the nearby activities. This neighborhood is filled with quaint cottages that surround a lovely tree-lined central park where people can enjoy picnicking & even basket ball. For younger children, the park offers hours of play time on the various play equipment. Located in the heart of town, walk to a day at the beach or the Monterey Recreation Trail for a great afternoon of fun. In summer, you will discover a small beach in a protected cove that often provides a calm sanctuary for water play at the water's edge. Nearby, the recreation trail offers biking and walking along a spectacular coastline where sea otters frolic in the kelp & whales and
host_about: My husband Richard & I have lived on the Monterey Peninsula for over 50 years and raised our family here in Pacific Grove. We are life long travelers & sailors and have logged many miles throughout the years sailing along the California coast, Mexico, Central America to the Panama Canal & throughout the South Pacific to New Zealand & back to California. We love the adventure of meeting new people from around the world & learning about their way of life, their unique perspectives & cultural histories. We have always considered ourselves lucky to return to our home port of Monterey & Pacific Grove as we consider it to be one of the most scenically spectacular places in the world. Pacific Grove is a very special coastal community as it offers a small town feel along with stunning geographic beauty and many interesting outdoor activities that we enjoy. Favorite activities just steps from our cottage include an 18 mile bike & walking path where we go to enjoy an evening sunset or visit the Monterey Bay Aquarium with friends & family. We enjoy good food & often dine at the fine restaurants in downtown Pacific Grove, nearby Cannery Row, Carmel By-the-Sea, and south to Big Sur. Hiking in Point Lobos, Big Sur, & Carmel Valley's Garland Park are a great way to spend a day & our favorite activity is sailing our 40' Passport on beautiful Monterey Bay where whales & otters can be spotted year round. Just around the corner from Lover's Point Beach & Park, our cottage offers all that makes Pacific Grove a destination to enjoy. Our cottage offers a casual & relaxing get-a-way to share with family and friends & we look forward to offering this special place to fellow intrepid travelers from around the world.

host_about:
Sanctuary Vacation Rentals represents properties throughout Carmel, Pebble Beach, Pacific Grove, Carmel Highlands, and the Big Sur coastline. We combine fine resort accommodations and relaxed elegance with all the comforts of home. 
Our properties are places that nurture and inspire and are located in one of the most beautiful, energizing places in the world, featuring the spectacular scenery of the Monterey Peninsula and the central coast of California.  From historic old Monterey, to the Victorian charm of Pacific Grove, and the artists colony of Carmel-by-the-Sea, and the breathtaking scenery of Big Sur, generations of people have been rejuvenated by the breaking waves and sandy beaches here.
Our properties are designer furnished with relaxed elegance.  Many homes feature the colors of the sea and take inspiration from the natural beauty of the surrounding areas.
Throughout Sanctuary’s vacation rentals, you’ll find comfortable beds with luxury linens, welcome beverages and hors d’oeuvres, spa robes and amenities, local wine tasting and spa passes, and a personal concierge to assist you in every way.  Our homes feature chef’s dream kitchens and everything you’ll need to entertain in style.  And many of our properties are pet friendly.
If you’re looking for a refreshing, relaxed stay in one of the most beautiful areas in the world– offering all the comforts of home, let Sanctuary Vacation Rentals help you discover your own sanctuary by the sea.  

The Monterey Peninsula is unique in its combination of breathtaking natural resources and a multiplicity of cultural and entertainment possibilities. You can find something for every possible taste. For nature lovers, there is the diversity of mountain and sea, for picnicking, surfing, fishing, horseback riding, hiking, beach-combing, bird-watching, kayaking, scuba diving, tide-pooling, biking and more. If you want a man-made excitement, we have art galleries galore, excellent fine-art museums, local theatre, outstanding restaurants, boutiques, a natural history and a children's museum, a world-class aquarium, and that's just for starters. History buffs will have a field day exploring the adobes of Monterey. There's so much to do that you cannot possibly do it all in one visit, which means you will have to come back.

neighborhood_overview:
Pacific Grove is a coastal city known for its Victorian homes, Asilomar Beach, and its coastal migration of Monarch butterflies (Butterfly Town, USA). The city is also home to the oldest continuously working lighthouse on the West Coast, Point Pinos. The Pacific Grove Natural History Museum, located in downtown PG, is a living field guide to the Central Coast, showcasing native flora and fauna.
The Monterey Bay Coastal Recreation Trail offers breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean and is a wonderful way to tour PG, Monterey, and surrounding areas, while enjoying the outdoors.
